item.title: Airgap your Raspberry Pi on a shoestring budget
item.description: To run for example k3s, kubernetes or other more disk intensive applications on your Raspberry Pi 4 I needed to migrate from the internal SD card to an external USB3 SSD drive. Raspberry Pi can boot from USB, and this is how it’s done. This is what you need to configure your raspberry pi: A USB3 SATA or M.2 case SSD disk Os already installed on the old SD card Set up Boot up your rpi4 on the SD card.
